question.text: In which case does FERPA allow postsecondary institutions the option to provide parents with personally identifiable information?
question.option: If the student is under the age of 18
If the parents are responsible for paying the student's tuition
If the student is a dependent for income tax purposes
If the parent suspects the student is abusing drugs or alcohol

question.text: Rights under FERPA are transferred from the parent to the student in which of the following cases?
question.option: When the student reaches the age of 18
When the student is attending a postsecondary institution
When the student requests his rights
After the student has found employment
